docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20. -- The United States reaffirmed her neutrality with reference to the civil war in Spain in a note tonight from William Phillips, Acting Secretary of State, to Jose Richling, the Minister of Uruguay, declaring her inability to...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20. -- The United States reaffirmed her neutrality with reference to the civil war in Spain in a note tonight from William Phillips, Acting Secretary of State, to Jose Richling, the Minister of Uruguay, declaring her inability to accept the suggestion of the Montevideo government for mediation of the strife in Spain by the American republics.
docs.abstract: U S reaffirms neutrality, declares inability to accept Uruguayan proposal for mediation; text of note; status of Rebels hindrance to Uruguay plan; Mex rejects proposal

headline.main: U.S. DECLINES A BID TO MEDIATE IN SPAIN; Reply to Uruguay Cites Our Policy of Non-Interference in Domestic Matters. WISDOM OF MOVE DOUBTED Capital Believes Madrid's Fall Would Cause Reich and Italy to Recognize Rebels. U.S. DECLINES BID TO MEDIATE IN SPAIN

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Aug. 21. -- Diplomatic relations between Bolivia and Paraguay were declared re-established in a formal agreement signed this afternoon by their delegates to the Chaco peace conference.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Aug. 21. -- Diplomatic relations between Bolivia and Paraguay were declared re-established in a formal agreement signed this afternoon by their delegates to the Chaco peace conference.

headline.main: BOLIVIA, PARAGUAY RESUME RELATIONS; Formal Agreement Signed at Peace Conference as Compromise Is Reached.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: RAIL EQUIPMENT ORDERS; Lines Place Contracts for Rolling Stock With Various Companies.

docs.snippet: International complications arising from the Spanish revolt multiplied ominously last week, the fifth week of civil war. German and British toes in particular were trod upon, and both Berlin and London took vigorous action.
docs.lead_paragraph: International complications arising from the Spanish revolt multiplied ominously last week, the fifth week of civil war. German and British toes in particular were trod upon, and both Berlin and London took vigorous action.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 21. -- Nothing that has happened since the Spanish-American War has aroused such keen personal interest in Latin America as the present civil war in Spain. To most Latin Americans a European war is a quarrel among neighbors which...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 21. -- Nothing that has happened since the Spanish-American War has aroused such keen personal interest in Latin America as the present civil war in Spain. To most Latin Americans a European war is a quarrel among neighbors which does not affect them personally and their interest therefore is largely academic.

headline.main: SPANISH REPUBLICS URGE PEACE MOVE; All Latin-American States Feel Deeply the Struggle Waged in the Mother Country.

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITESpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Aug. 27. -- Vague suggestions for League of Nations reform, apparently aimed at weakening the covenant, were received today by the League from Uruguay. This is the first definite answer that has come to the invitation to League members to...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Aug. 27. -- Vague suggestions for League of Nations reform, apparently aimed at weakening the covenant, were received today by the League from Uruguay. This is the first definite answer that has come to the invitation to League members to submit suggestions.

headline.main: URUGUAY SUGGESTS LEAGUE RESTRICTION; Leans to Regional Groups to Act in Disputes -- Danzig on Council Agenda.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: ABOARD PRISON SHIP URUGUAY, off Barcelona, Spain, Aug. 23. -- Before this account of their trial is published these four men who are now in the dock in front of us will most probably have been shot. They are being judged today for the crime of...
docs.lead_paragraph: ABOARD PRISON SHIP URUGUAY, off Barcelona, Spain, Aug. 23. -- Before this account of their trial is published these four men who are now in the dock in front of us will most probably have been shot. They are being judged today for the crime of military rebellion.

headline.main: FEAR HAUNTS TRIAL ON BARCELONA SHIP; Court-Martial of Officers Shows Judges Must Act as Inflamed Populace Demands. DEFENSE MERE FORMALITY Prosecutor Asks Death Penalty Not Only for Leaders of Revolt but Also Their Subordinates.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
